result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher S. Powell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 10:58 a.m. 
**Includes 14CF1061, 14CF870 & 14CM2130**
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt. Defendant appears in custody with Atty Zach Glascock 14CF1061 and Atty Kat Jackan on 14CF870 & 14CM2130. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed on 14CF1061. 
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived. Plea not entered as parties are ready to proceed with Plea Hearing on all files. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed. VRCW. 
State moves to: 14CF870- DRI Ct. 4 Misapprop. ID Info, DRI Ct. 5 Misapprop. ID Info & DRI Ct.6 Theft- Movable Property
                           14CF1061- DRI Ct.1 Battery by Prisoners & DRI Ct.2 Bail Jumping (Misd)
                           14CM2130- DRI Ct.1 Theft- Movable Property
COURT GRANTS.                            
PLEA: 14CF870- Ct.1 Misapprop. ID Info (Repeater)>> NO CONTEST 
                             Ct.2 Misapprop. ID Info (Repeater)>> NO CONTEST 
                             Ct.3 Misapprop. ID Info (Repeater)>> NO CONTEST 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty on 14CF870- Ct.1-3. 
COURT ORDERS: SWH- 4 years probation concurrent to all counts. CONDITIONS: 9 months MCJ w/huber for work & counseling with credit for 107 days, absolute sobriety, AODA and any follow-up, assessment, treatment and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent, no contact with victims, GFE to obtain/maintain full time employment, schooling or a combination of both; if defendant is not working or going to school, he must complete 10 verifiable job searches and 5 hours of CS per week, letter of apology to victims, CC & 1 DNA surcharge. 
COURT advises defendant regarding possession of firearms and voting rights. Voter Ineligibility Notice & Acknowledgment signed and filed. 
Adj: 11:10 a.m.
Preliminary Hearing on February 4, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 10:24 a.m. 
**Includes 14CF870, 14CF1061 & 14CM2130**
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo for Amanda Jadin. Defendant appears in custody, with Atty Kathryn Jackan. 
Date & time set for motion on modification of bond on 14CF870 & 14CF1061. Defense requests cash bond be modified to signature bond. State makes argument. 
COURT ORDERS: BOND MODIFICATION IS DENIED. 
Preliminary hearing to be scheduled on 14CF1061 as soon as possible. 
Adj: 10:29 a.m.

Clerk Shirley
Case Called: 10:37
State appears by ADA Lesli Pluster; Deft appears in person, in custody. Atty Jackan does not appear.
Atty Pluster states that Atty Jackan stated earlier that they were checking for any conflicts.
Court waives time limits for cause.
Dates have been set in Br 2 
Bond:  Continued
Adj: 10:42

INCLUDES 14CF1061 & 14CF870  No contact with victim(s): R.G. & C.B. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
